result.execSummary:
The defendant Dallas J Junaitis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Party to a Crime]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt w/SDC
no fee paid,letter explaining fee and monthly payments to be paid.

2:31 PM -  Defendant appears with counsel Elisabeth Stockbridge,  Alec Ballo appears for the State.  Verification that the restitution has been paid in full.  DA moves to amend the charge to an Ordinance D.C. with a forfeiture of $150.00 + costs.  No contest plea to the amended charge and is found guilty by the Court.  Court imposes the $150 fine plus costs.

3:57 PM Defendant Dallas J Junaitis in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Bela Alexander Ballo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant had medical issues which prevented him from paying restitution.  Is getting a settlement sometime this week and requests an adjournment to pay restitution in full.  Court questions the agreement and will adjourn but no further adjournments.  If restitution is not paid in full by adjourn date DA wants this matter set for trial.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 21, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 12, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 6, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 1, 2018 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
